decks.notes: This deck is focused on aggressive strategies, aiming to quickly overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient creatures. The key concept revolves around playing powerful and disruptive creatures like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn, while also using removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push to control the board. The deck also utilizes vehicles like Heart of Kiran for additional aggression and value. By utilizing a mix of creatures, removal, and vehicles, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on the interaction between Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create an infinite combo that allows you to create an unlimited number of Felidar Guardian tokens. The deck also includes cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Whirler Virtuoso to support the combo and generate value. By utilizing cards like Oath of Nissa and Attune with Aether to ensure consistent mana fixing, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and difficult to disrupt combo.

The key strategy of this deck is to assemble the Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian combo to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, allowing for unlimited abilities and potentially winning the game on the spot. The deck also includes a mix of strong removal and energy-generating cards to support the combo pieces and control the game until the combo can be assembled. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells while also providing consistency and stability for the deck's performance.

This deck focuses on deploying threats quickly and efficiently to pressure the opponent and finish the game as fast as possible. It utilizes powerful aggro creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Heart of Kiran, along with removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push to maintain board control. Thalia, Heretic Cathar disrupts the opponent's mana base, while Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional threats and generates more creatures. The deck aims to be proactive, aggressive, and resilient, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on creating infinite combos by using Saheeli Rai's -2 ability to copy Felidar Guardian, which flickers Saheeli Rai and allows the player to repeat the process infinitely. This combo generates an army of hasty creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards that provide mana acceleration, card draw, and removal to support the combo and help protect the key pieces. Additionally, planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance provide additional utility and value to the deck's game plan.

The deck is focused on creating a powerful combo using Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian. This combo allows for infinite enters-the-battlefield triggers, which can be used to generate infinite creatures, mana, or other effects to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck includes support cards such as Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Whirler Virtuoso to help with mana and card advantage, as well as removal spells like Harnessed Lightning to control the board until the combo can be assembled.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play creatures and vehicles to quickly pressure the opponent's life total. The deck includes powerful threats like Heart of Kiran, Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, and Toolcraft Exemplar, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Unlicensed Disintegration to clear the way for attacks. The mana base is carefully curated to ensure smooth casting of spells, while also including utility lands like Needle Spires and Shambling Vent for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and apply consistent pressure to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy. Key cards such as Heart of Kiran, Toolcraft Exemplar, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar allow for early pressure and board presence. Supporting cards like Scrapheap Scrounger and Walking Ballista provide additional threats and utility. Thalia, Heretic Cathar disrupts the opponent's game plan while Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push help control the board. Aethersphere Harvester offers additional resilience. This deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while dealing consistent damage to the opponent.

The deck revolves around using the combo of Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite copies of Felidar Guardian, allowing for a repeatable blink effect that can ultimately lead to victory. The deck includes various energy-generating spells and creatures to ensure consistency in casting the combo pieces, as well as planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Tamiyo, Field Researcher to provide additional value and support. This combo-centric strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with an endless stream of Felidar Guardian tokens, ultimately securing the win.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly building a strong board presence with aggressive creatures like Longtusk Cub and Winding Constrictor, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Verdurous Gearhulk. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Grasp of Darkness to control the opponent's board. Aethersphere Harvester provides additional resilience and lifegain, while cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Gonti, Lord of Luxury offer card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disrupt their game plan with removal spells.

This deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay by utilizing efficient creatures and powerful removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By curving out with low-cost creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Thraben Inspector, the deck can pressure the opponent early on. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Heart of Kiran provide additional threats that require immediate answers, while cards like Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push help to clear the way for attacks. With a mix of threats and disruption, this deck aims to establish board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Thalia, Heretic Cathar, supported by cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Heart of Kiran. Removal spells such as Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push allow for control of the board while creatures like Scrapheap Scrounger provide recurring threats. The deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board position to overwhelm opponents swiftly before they can stabilize. The flexible mana base ensures consistency in casting spells while also providing aggressive threats with Needle Spires and Shambling Vent.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on fielding fast and aggressive creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Scrapheap Scrounger while leveraging cards like Heart of Kiran and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar for additional pressure. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Fatal Push to clear the opponent's board and maintain control of the battlefield. With a mix of creatures, spells, and planeswalkers, this deck aims to apply early pressure and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on playing efficient creatures and powerful vehicles to build a fast and aggressive board presence. It utilizes cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, Toolcraft Exemplar, and Heart of Kiran to apply pressure early in the game. With a mix of removal spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Shock, as well as creatures that can return from the graveyard like Scrapheap Scrounger, this deck aims to maintain momentum and overwhelm opponents quickly. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the aggressive strategy while providing consistent access to all three colors.

This deck focuses on using Aetherworks Marvel to quickly ramp up energy, allowing for the early casting of powerful spells like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. By efficiently generating and utilizing energy resources, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and impactful spells. The deck also includes cards like Whirler Virtuoso and Tireless Tracker to provide additional value and board presence. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently generating energy resources to fuel the powerful combos and threats in the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to use Aetherworks Marvel to cheat powerful cards like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger onto the battlefield early. The deck is designed to generate energy through cards like Attune with Aether and Whirler Virtuoso while controlling the board with counterspells like Negate and removal spells like Harnessed Lightning. By assembling the energy engine and hitting Marvel activations, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and game-winning plays.
